title: Instagram CEO testifies about competing with TikTok: ‘You’re either growing, or you’re slowly dying’
description: When Adam Mosseri took over Meta-owned Instagram as CEO in 2018, the app was experiencing what he'd later call "concerning" drops and plateaus in user engagement, thanks partly to fierce competition from a new app: TikTok. Instagram estimated in 2019 that 23 …

title: Trump Nominates Former N.E.A. Chair to Head Embattled Arts Agency
description: The president nominated Mary Anne Carter to lead the National Endowment for the Arts, which his budget calls for eliminating and which has been withdrawing grants from arts groups.

title: On the Chopping Block: Arts and Humanities
description: The plan to eliminate the endowments for the arts and the humanities. Also: A threat to impose tariffs on movies made abroad.

title: A Small West African Country Has Big Artistic Dreams
description: Guinea-Bissau, where there are virtually no art galleries, no art schools and little government funding for the arts, has just staged its first biennale.

title: A Patron of the Arts in Denver Who Was ‘Saved by Collecting’
description: About 10 years ago, Amanda Precourt turned her attention to buying art. She now sponsors shows and is opening an exhibition space in an old cookie factory.

title: An Arts Hub and Affordable Housing Under One Roof in Inwood
description: The developers of the Miramar hope the building will be a good neighbor through its design, its partnership with cultural organizations and its mixed-income model.

title: Some ‘Les Misérables’ Cast Members Plan to Skip Trump Kennedy Center Gala
description: Several members of the “Les Misérables” cast are said to be planning to boycott a gala performance at the Kennedy Center, which President Trump took over as chairman.

title: Cassie’s Trip From Star to Star Witness May Spell Trouble for Sean Combs
description: The music mogul’s former girlfriend accused him of years of abuse in a bombshell 2023 lawsuit. Now she’s taken the stand at his federal trial.

title: Christo and Jeanne-Claude, Legendary Artists, Are Back in Spirit
description: Known for their outsized and revolutionary art projects, the couple’s work is seen again in Florida, New York and Germany.

title: Review: Will ‘The Death of Rasputin’ Have a Cult Following?
description: The immersive production on Governors Island is an attempt to fill the void left by “Sleep No More” and “Life and Trust.”

title: La Scala Taps South Korean Maestro as Music Director
description: Myung-whun Chung will be the first Asian, and one of the first conductors born outside Italy, to serve as music director in the opera house’s 247-year history.

title: Jon Stewart on Trump’s $400m Qatari jet: ‘He’s like the reverse Oprah’

title: School visits to UK museums hit by ‘shortage of means’, philanthropist says

title: Ancient example of printed text to be displayed in Melbourne: ‘It unites us all’
description: A Japanese prayer scroll dating back more than 1,250 years has been acquired by the State Library of Victoria and will feature alongside other rare books items in an exhibition later this month

title: Arts groups for people of color steel themselves after Trump’s NEA cuts: ‘They poked the bear’
description: Trump’s slashing of millions in National Endowment for the Arts grants has most affected non-profits centering Black, brown and LGBTQ+ communities
